title: Sultan Qaboos Sports Complex
text:
The Sultan Qaboos Stadium at the Sultan Qaboos Sports Complex (), also known locally as Boshar (), is a government-owned <a href="multi-purpose%20stadium">multi-purpose stadium</a> in the <a href="Bawshar">Boshar</a> district of <a href="Muscat">Muscat</a>, <a href="Oman">Oman</a>. It is currently used mostly for <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> matches, and also has facilities for athletics. The stadium originally had a capacity of over 40,000, but after recent renovations the capacity was reduced to 34,000. It is the home stadium of the <a href="Oman%20national%20football%20team">Oman national football team</a>. The Qaboos Stadium was used as the main stadium in the <a href="2009%20Gulf%20Cup%20of%20Nations">2009 Gulf Cup of Nations</a>, and was also used in the <a href="1996%20Gulf%20Cup%20of%20Nations">1996 Gulf Cup</a> competition. The Complex has strong security, in addition to over 10,000 parking slots.
In <a href="field%20hockey">field hockey</a>, the stadium hosted the <a href="2018%20Men%27s%20Asian%20Champions%20Trophy">2018 Men's Asian Champions Trophy</a>.
